title: Demands grow for 'green industrial revolution'
description: Campaigners demand the government prioritises the environment in any post-Covid-19 stimulus package.

title: 'My brothers on Europe's last death row'
description: Any day now two men may be executed in Europe's only country that still has the death penalty.

title: Coronavirus: How the UK is sleeping under lockdown
description: More than half the population has struggled with sleep during the lockdown, especially younger people.

title: 'We're all still grieving' - care home staff on impact of virus
description: Care home staff from the charity MHA look back at the impact of the coronavirus crisis.

title: White House likens Trump to Churchill in WW2
description: The press secretary compares the president to the British wartime leader inspecting bomb damage.

title: Sudan banned FGM - what happens next?
description: FGM was outlawed by Sudan's new Sovereign Council, who have been in power since August 2019.

title: Coronavirus in Russia: 'I don't trust Putin any more'
description: In Russia, coronavirus ahs seen the long-time president's approval rating fall to an all-time low.

title: The 100-year wound that Hungary cannot forget
description: Hungary lost two-thirds of its territory in the 1920 Trianon treaty and now aims to revive its past.

title: 'You audition for a show only for it to get cancelled’
description: With theatres closed, and TV and movie filming on hold, acting school graduates are struggling.

title: Coronavirus: 'I may lose it all, but there’s no help for me'
description: Layla Barnes is one of thousands of small business owners who are getting no government support in the pandemic.

title: Viewpoint: What it's like to be an African in the US
description: Kenyan journalist Larry Madowo writes about the racism he has experienced in the US.

title: Premier League clubs to discuss options if season ends early
description: Premier League clubs are set to discuss on Thursday what should happen if the season comes to a premature conclusion.

title: George Floyd death: How many black people die in police custody in England and Wales?
description: George Floyd's death has sparked protests across the world and raised questions about police practice.

title: Nude sunbather mistaken for dead body near railway line in Essex
description: Rail workers spotted a pair of feet "but no signs of life" within the railway boundary in Essex.

title: Bafta TV Awards: Fleabag and Game of Thrones up for 'must-see moment'
description: Viewers have until 15 July to cast their vote for the only Bafta TV award decided on by the public.

title: 'I’m ready to face quarantine just to get away'
description: As the UK's 14-day quarantine plan looms, many have decided to take a summer holiday regardless.

title: Coronavirus: Schools to reopen in Wales on 29 June
description: Parents who choose not to send their children to school when they reopen will not be fined.

title: Three West Indies players opt out of England tour because of coronavirus fears
description: Three West Indies players choose not to travel to England for next month's Test series because of coronavirus fears.

title: Cyclone Nisarga lashes areas near Mumbai
description: The worst storm to threaten India's megacity in decades is battering areas on the west coast.

title: Man charged with murdering wife and daughter in Salisbury
description: Nikoletta Zdun, 18, and Aneta Zdun, 40, died at a home in Salisbury on Monday.

title: Coronavirus: Labour urges PM to stop 'winging it' over easing restrictions
description: The PM is accused of "winging it" by Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer and risking a new wave of infections.

title: Amazon to make its Premier League games free when season restarts
description: Amazon Prime will make its four Premier League games free-to-air when the season restarts.

title: George Floyd death: More large protests in US but violence falls
description: Many defied curfews but the violence was not on the scale of Monday night.

title: Disruption to schools could continue to November, MPs told
description: Disruption to school in England could continue into the autumn until November, MPs are told

title: PMQs: Labour leader Starmer's political distancing
description: There is a change in tone from the opposition leader towards Boris Johnson, but what is his plan?

title: Coronavirus contact tracer 'paid to watch Netflix'
description: A clinician on the NHS Test and Trace scheme tells the BBC of her frustration at not receiving work.

title: Coronavirus: Sweden's Tegnell admits too many died
description: Anders Tegnell says more should have been done early on to stem coronavirus in Sweden.

title: Coronavirus: UK holidaymakers ‘welcome’ in Portugal
description: Portugal's foreign minister tells the BBC that an "air bridge" agreement could be in place soon.

title: OK Beeb: BBC voice assistant will learn regional accents
description: A male northern voice is the BBC's initial choice for its voice assistant, in the testing phase.

title: MOTD: Top 10 podcast - rank these iconic home nations moments
description: There have been some iconic moments for the home nations since 1966 - but what did BBC Sport pundits consider the best?

title: 'It's a dark place' - Sweden's six-month pre-season
description: In Sweden, pre-season - that period hated by so many footballers - is into its sixth month. We find out how players are coping with the physical and mental challenges.

title: George Floyd death: The man who sheltered 80 US protesters
description: Hundreds of people found themselves trapped by police - until Rahul Dubey flung open his doors.

description: Four years before George Floyd's death made global headlines, another man was shot dead in the same part of the US.

title: UK to change immigration rules for Hong Kong citizens if China passes law
description: Britain will change its immigration rules for Hong Kong citizens if China passes a new law, the PM says.
